quote: We are losing containment in the   starboard nacelle tube --
Try to get more power to the field   coils.
Yes, sir.
Geordi, report.
I can't shut down the plasma   injectors -- someone's locked out   the controls.
The plasma venting system has   engaged.
Two more decks --
Riker to Bridge -- we've almost   reached the nacelle tube.
Acknowledged.       Release the exterior hull plate.   We may have to jettison the core.
What happened?
He locked out the controls...   before we knew what was happening,   he stepped up onto the walkway.
See if you can shut down the   plasma flow.
I'm afraid if we try to get any   closer, he'll jump through the   forecefield.
Dan...
It's me... Wil Riker.
I was here yesterday, remember?
I didn't... want to do it...   but... I saw them... and... they   laughed at me... they laughed...
Whatever happened, we can talk   about it. I want to help.
Stay away!
I want you to be able to see me,   that's all... so we can talk.
I... know... what I have to do...
Dan, wait --
I have unlocked the controls --
Shut down procedure initiated.
There's still plasma in the   injector -- it'll take time to   vent off...
Tell me what happened. Maybe I   can help.
I know what I have to do...
A few more seconds and we could've   saved his life...
Commander... you did everything   you could. It was not your fault.
I had the strangest feeling   that... he didn't even recognize   me -- and I was with him just the   other day when I supervised the   tube refit.
How did he seem then?
Fine. In fact I complimented him   for getting the refit done faster   than expected. He was pleased   that I noticed.
I met with him during crew   evaluations about six weeks ago.   He was very positive; he was   looking forward to being posted to   the nacelle tube.
He was a fine officer, with a good   career ahead of him. I just don't   understand why he would want to...

In my years as a Starship Captain,   I've had to notify many families   that they'd lost a loved one. But   never to suicide. I'd like to be   able to offer Lieutenant Kwan's   family some explanation for what   happened -- to help them make   sense of it.
He may have left a message of some   kind, explaining why he did it.
I want the two of you to try and   piece together a picture of his   last few days.
If he made any personal logs, it   might be helpful to go through   them.
You're authorized to do so.
La Forge to Captain.
Go ahead.
I've completed a damage   assessment. We should be able to   get underway within the hour.
Geordi, the medical situation on   Barson Two has worsened --   Starfleet has given us permission   to exceed warp speed limitations   so we can get back on schedule.
We'll be able to give you warp   eight if you need it.
Acknowledged.
Geordi, would you agree that the   instinct for self-preservation is   shared by most life forms?
I'd say it's probably the most   basic instinct.
That being the case, I am having   difficulty understanding why   someone would deliberately   terminate their own existence.
I don't know, Data. All I can   think is that maybe Lieutenant   Kwan felt like there was   something... wrong in his life,   something he felt powerless to   fix.
I believe I understand. I have   been in a similar situation.
Really?
The first months following my   activation were a difficult period   for me... there were many   problems associated with my   becoming sentient.
Because your neural net was still   forming.
As I acquired new skills, neural   pathways would form and take the   place of other, less complex   pathways. It was very...   disorienting.
Sure sounds like it.

As my systems grew in complexity,   it became increasingly difficult   to integrate new pathways into my   existing neural net. The   probability of cascade failure   grew with each added pathway. I   came to the conclusion that it   would be easier and safer to shut   myself down and start again.
But if you did that, you wouldn't   have remembered any of the things   that had happened to you.
In a way, it would have been   like... committing suicide.
So what did you do?
I decided against the procedure.   I chose instead to treat the   problems I was having with my   systems as... challenges to be   overcome, instead of obstacles to   be avoided.
That's a great way of looking at   it. It's too bad Lieutenant Kwan   wasn't able to look at his   problems the same way.
I've gone over Kwan's personnel   records -- he had an exceptionally   stable psychological profile.
When we were in the control room,   it seemed as if he were trying   to... explain something he'd   done... something terrible.
He'd been on the Enterprise over   two years. No one has ever   reported an altercation with him.
These were his quarters.
This is a Napean design...
His mother is Napean; his father's   human.
Everything looks so... normal.   For some reason I was half   expecting to find the place a   mess.
Yes... it is strange to think that   someone could be considering   ending his life and yet not give   any outward sign of it.
Right before he jumped, he seemed   almost... calm.
He must have been in a lot of pain   to do what he did. It could be   that the prospect of ending that   pain felt like a great relief.
This is Ensign... Calloway, isn't   it?
She is a medical technician in   Sickbay.
It's always hard to lose someone   you care about... but to lose them   like this...
We should start going over his   logs...
This is his last entry; he made it   before going on duty this morning.
Personal log, Stardate 47622.1.   We finally finished the nacelle   tube refit last night. After   pulling two double shifts in a   row, I'm really looking forward to   spending some time with Maddy.
Ensign Calloway...
That doesn't sound like a man   planning on ending his life.
No... it does not...
I can't believe he's really   gone... I keep thinking he's   going to show up and tell me   there's been some terrible   misunderstanding...
I thought you might like to know   that in his personal logs, Dan   talked about you a great deal. He   loved you very much.
If that's true... then how could   he... leave me like this?
That's what I'm trying to find   out. I know it's hard to talk   about right now... but it would be   very helpful if you could tell me   a few things about him.
When was the last time you saw   him?
Two nights ago... we were planning   our next shore leave together.
Did he mention anything that   happened recently... anything that   might have upset him?
No, not really... he did say   something about work, about   Lieutenant Nara, but it wasn't   anything serious.
Nara... she's his superior officer   in the nacelle tube.
Yes. Dan sensed that she... well,   that she felt threatened by him --   that she thought he was after her   position.
Was he prone to mood swings, or   depression?
No... but he was very sensitive to   other people's moods.
What do you mean?
Sometimes he would just... look at   me, and know what I was feeling --   I always loved that about him.
Napeans are partially empathic --   he may have inherited some of his   mother's abilities.
He used to tease me that when I   met her, I wouldn't be able to get   away with anything.
Dan and I knew each other for over   two years, but we didn't really   get together until a few months   ago. We took it slow...
We thought we had all the time in   the world...
Something must've happened to him,   Counselor. Something terrible   Because it's not like Dan to take   his own life. Please... find out   what it was.
I'm sorry --
I didn't see you there...
You're Lieutenant Nara, aren't   you?
Can I do something for you,   Counselor?
I'm investigating Lieutenant   Kwan's death. I just wanted to   take a look around.
It's such a shame. He was a good   man.
Did you notice any change in his   behavior recently?
No... I've been going over the   last few days in my mind, trying   to see if I missed any... warning   signs. It's as if something in   him just... snapped.
How was his job performance?
Excellent. He knew this ship   better than most people --   probably because he helped build   it back at Utopia Planitia.
Did he get along with his coworkers?
He was... ambitious. He came in   here with all sorts of new ideas   about how to do things -- some of   them very good ideas.
But not all?
No. But once he settled in, we   got along fine.
Excuse me for a minute. Feel free   to look around.
Where was Lieutenant Kwan's   station?
Right down there.
Are you all right?
I... don't know...
I don't know how to describe it...   I was suddenly overwhelmed by a   flood of emotions -- fear, rage,   panic.
Whose emotions? I thought you   said you were alone.
I was. The sensations didn't seem   to be coming from any one person --   they were just there, in the room.
I scanned the area -- I picked up   no anomalous readings.
How could you be getting an   empathic impression from an empty   room?
I don't know...
Could the fact that Kwan was   partially empathic have something   to do with it?
What do you mean?
I'm not sure... but the feelings   Troi described certainly seem   consistent with suicide.
Could his death have left some   sort of... empathic echo?
I suppose it's a possibility...   but I don't see how.
If I went back to the nacelle   tube, I might be able to get a   better sense of what I   experienced.
I'm not sure that's a good idea --   you're showing elevated levels of   psilosynine.
Psilosynine?
A neuro-transmitter involved in   telepathy.       The experience overwhelmed you the   first time. I don't think you   should go back until the levels   return to normal.
How long?
Three, maybe four hours.
Next time I want someone with you.
I will accompany you, Counselor.
Captain's Log, Stardate 47623.2.   We've arrived at Starbase Three-twenty-eight   on schedule. After   taking aboard medical supplies, we   will depart for Barson Two.
-- I ran into Maddy yesterday. We   stood in the corridor and talked   for almost an hour... The more I   get to know her, the more I   realize what a remarkable woman   she is...
Come in.
Hello, Worf.
Counselor...
Have you found anything in   Lieutenant Kwan's logs?
Everything I've seen indicates he   was well-adjusted and optimistic.       Were you able to talk with Ensign   Trake?
Yes... I interviewed all of Kwan's   co-workers.
From what I've read, Trake was his   best friend.
He observed nothing that indicated   Kwan was contemplating ending his   life. Nor did any of the others.
It just doesn't make any sense...
Can I get you anything?
No, thank you.
Yridian tea...
I've been thinking about what   happened to me in the nacelle   tube... whether it was an empathic   echo left by Kwan's death...
In the past, have your empathic   experiences always involved the   physical presence of another   person?
All the ones I'm sure of, yes.
What do you mean, sure of?
Well... when I was a young girl,   my Grandfather used to tell me   stories by the fire... I would   close my eyes and listen to his   mind for hours on end...
He told you these stories   telepathically... ?
My grandfather rarely spoke out   loud... He said that was for off-worlders   who didn't know any   better.
The only time I can remember his   stories is when I go home... and   sit by the fireplace. Sometimes   when I'm there, alone... it's   almost as if I can hear his voice   in my head.
Yes... I have sought visions in   fire.
I can't explain it, but it felt   very real to me. Just like what   happened in the nacelle tube.
There are things we do not   understand, yet they exist   nonetheless.
I keep thinking about Ensign   Calloway... she needs to know   what happened to Kwan -- it's the   only way she'll ever be able to   put his death behind her.
This must be a very difficult time   for her.

Do you know what she regrets most?   That she and Kwan didn't take full   advantage of the time they had   together... they knew each other   for a long time, but they didn't   get together until recently.
She wishes they had acted on their   feelings sooner... ?
Perhaps I should let you rest.
It's all right --
If you will excuse me, Counselor.
Worf...
Commander...
Two Til'amin froths, please.
Lieutenant Corell seems to be   enjoying your company.
I'd like to think so.
Are you... involved with her?
I'm not sure yet.
Why do you ask? Are you   interested in her?
No...
But if I were, I would of course   discuss the situation with you   before proceeding further.
I appreciate the thought, but you   really wouldn't have to do that.
I would never want to come between   you and anyone you were involved   with... or had ever been involved   with.
Is there... someone in particular   you're talking about?
No. Is there... someone in   particular you would prefer I not   become involved with?
Worf... you sound like a man   asking a friend if he can start   dating his sister.
No, I am merely... never mind.   Excuse me, sir.
Could you open this door for me?
Yes, but only for a short time.   After ninety seconds the plasma   venting system will engage to   prevent degradation of the   forcefield.
I just want to take a quick   look...
May I ask what you are looking   for?
I'm... not sure...
Warning -- plasma venting system   will engage in ninety seconds.
No... please... don't...
Plasma venting system will engage   in... eighty seconds.
Worf... ?
Worf, where are you?
Counselor... are you all right --
Get me out of here...
Do you remember anything else?
I saw a tool crate on the floor...   it was labeled Utopia Planitia.
The shipyard where the Enterprise   was built.
Clearly this was much more than an   empathic echo. It seems that you   were actually seeing something   that happened in the control room   eight years ago.
Everyone was looking directly at   me. It's almost as if... I were   seeing through someone else's   eyes.
Lieutenant Kwan was partially   empathic...
Maybe you were seeing through his   eyes?
It's a possibility... but I don't   understand how it could have   happened.

Let's put that question aside for   a moment and assume that by some   unexplained phenomenon, you   witnessed an event that may have   involved Lieutenant Kwan.       The faces you saw -- did you   recognize them?

I don't think I've ever seen the   woman before, or the man who was   with her. But there was someone   else there. A man... he was   staring at me in the most peculiar   way. I think he had... reddish   hair. He seemed familiar to me...   but it's all so hazy, like trying   to remember a dream.
The woman seemed terrified of   something... then you saw her   again, laughing -- presumably at   Lieutenant Kwan.
What could it all mean?
I don't know. But something   terrible happened in that room.   I felt it.
Counselor... I want you to look   over the personnel files from   Utopia Planitia and see if you can   identify the faces you saw.
If only there were some way I   could go back to the control room   and not be overwhelmed by the   experience -- it might help me   remember some detail that could be   relevant.
I could give you an inhibitor that   would slow your brain's production   of psilosynine. That would   probably suppress your empathic   abilities enough to make the   experience manageable.
I'd like to try.
Very well, Counselor.
It'll take about sixteen hours to   synthesize the inhibitor.
I apologize for being late. The   viral medicines we are   transporting to Barson Two require   special security measures to   insure they are properly   contained.
Have you found anything?
No... there were literally   thousands of people involved in   building the Enterprise.
Perhaps if you found a way to   narrow the search parameters.

I think I have. The man who   seemed familiar to me may have   been on board the Enterprise   during the last seven years. I've   asked the computer to limit its   search to personnel who've served   at Utopia Planitia and on the   ship.
Ensign Salvatore... he transferred   off the Enterprise last year.
Lieutenant Ziff... she's in   quantum mechanics.
That's him.
Lieutenant Walter Pierce...
I remember now... he came aboard   about six months ago. I think   he's in Engineering.
You were Lieutenant Kwan's   supervisor at Utopia Planitia.
That's right. I was sorry to hear   what happened...
Did you spend time in the nacelle   control room while it was under   construction?
I worked all over the ship. In   fact, I remember running a power   conduit right behind that wall   there.
Were you ever in the nacelle room   at the same time as Lieutenant   Kwan?
It was a long time ago... people   were working all over the place.
So you do not remember?
I'm sorry, I don't.
Do you recall if anything...   unusual happened there?
How do you mean?
An altercation, perhaps. Possibly   involving Lieutenant Kwan.
No... nothing like that. The way   I remember it, things went pretty   smoothly.
What's this all about? If you   don't mind my asking.
Not at all. You see, when I went   into the nacelle room, I had an...   empathic experience.
We believe she may have been   seeing some event that occurred   there eight years ago.
And -- I saw you there.
Do you have any idea why that   might be?
I'm afraid I don't.
Lieutenant... you're probably   aware that I can sense whether   someone's telling the truth.
I've heard that.
I'm sure, then, that if you were   to... remember anything that might   be relevant to our investigation,   you'd contact me.
Of course.
Thank you, Lieutenant.
Counselor...
The strange thing is I couldn't   read him at all.
But you implied that you could...
We have played poker together many   times. I have never known you to   bluff.
Well... it wouldn't be much of a   bluff if you knew, would it?
The fact that I couldn't read him   suggests that he has at least some   telepathic ability...
But Pierce is human.
That's what I don't understand...
Even though I couldn't read his   emotions, it did seem to me that   he was... holding something back.
Yes. I thought so as well.
Maybe we should try to access the   Engineering Logs from Utopia   Planitia. We might find out more   about him.
There might be something in them   about Lieutenant Kwan, as well.
It looks like it'll take about   half an hour for the transmission   to be completed.
Perhaps we should continue in the   morning... ?
It is late.
Yes, you must be tired.
A little...
Well. I will say good night.
Good night.
We should get an early start   tomorrow.
Yes. We should.
See you in the morning...
Yes...
Deanna...
Hello...
Breakfast is ready...
Mmm... that sounds good...
But it can wait...
Why didn't we do this a long time   ago... ?
Crusher to Counselor Troi.
Yes, Doctor.
I've synthesized the inhibitor;   you can come to Sickbay whenever   you're ready.
Acknowledged.
Crusher to Lieutenant Worf.
Worf, here.
The medical supplies are ready to   be taken to the cargo bay for   transport.
I will be there shortly.
There... you should start feeling   the effect immediately.
How completely will it suppress my   empathic abilities?
It's hard to say for sure... I can   raise the dosage if you find it's   not enough.
-- the cargo bay will be off-limits   to all but medical   personnel.
Thanks for your help, sir.
Good morning.
Counselor...
Data and Geordi are already in the   nacelle room. Are you ready?
Excuse me, sir. About the   quarantine field in the cargo   bay...
Yes.
It looks like we're going to need   a second field generator.
I am needed here. I will join you   as soon as I can.
All right...
Counselor, you okay?
I'm fine. The inhibitor seems to   be working.       Have you found anything?
Nothing unusual.
I don't remember seeing this   console during my empathic   experience. Has it been here   since the ship was built?
No, we installed it about two   years ago.
I remember seeing some sort of   power conduit...
Right there.
The main ODN line runs right   behind that panel... it lifts out   so you can get to it.
Kwan was working on that conduit   the day before he died.
Can you open it?
Sure... it'll just take a minute.
Lieutenant... the work Lieutenant   Kwan was doing, was it unusual in   any way?
He was refitting a field coil.   But it was probably the first time   that particular panel's been   opened since the ship was built.
Let's set it down right here...
Counselor?
Are you all right?
Something happened... when you   took off the panel...
There must be something there...
I am picking up readings that   indicate there is organic material   imbedded in the wall...
Organic material?
You're right... let me reconfigure   the emitter beam. We might be   able to see what it is...
There...
This dosage should prevent any   further empathic flashes.
The bone fragments are definitely   human... I sequenced a DNA sample;   I'll see if I can match it to   Starfleet records.
I'd say these fragments had been   in the wall about seven or eight   years.
You said something happened when   the panel was opened...
Yes...
I wonder if the fragments   themselves could've somehow   triggered your experience. I'll   run a resonance scan, see if   anything turns up.
Sir, I think we've found a   match...
Apparently the remains are those   of an Ensign Marla Finn --
I'm trying to find a picture of   her in the records...
That's her. That's the woman I   saw.
She was reported missing from   Utopia Planitia on Stardate   40987.2. Eight years ago...
How could her body have ended up   embedded inside a bulkhead... ?
Maybe there was some kind of...   accident.
Or she was killed. And the   murderer hid her remains.
Something's not right... pull up   Lieutenant Kwan's service record.
I thought so... he didn't arrive   at the shipyard until six months   after Finn's death.       I couldn't have been seeing   through his eyes...
Then whose... ?
It had to have been someone who   was at least partially telepathic.
Pierce... ?
But you saw him there.
Yes, but not as clearly as I saw   everything else... his face   looked...
Like that.
A reflection...
I was seeing through his eyes.
And Finn was trying to get away   from him; she was afraid of him...
I think it is time we had   another... conversation with   Lieutenant Pierce.
Ensign Calloway...
Thank you for your help.
Deck ten.
Worf... I want to ask you   something...
Do you regret what happened last   night?
No... of course not.
Are you sure? Because I don't   want anything to jeopardize our   friendship.
Deanna... I do not regret being   with you.
Is something wrong?
I just... don't feel myself.   Maybe it's the inhibitor -- I'm so   used to sensing what people are   feeling... now I can't.
Perhaps I should talk to   Lieutenant Pierce alone.
That might be a good idea...
I will meet you in your quarters.
I'll be waiting for you...
Deck eight.
Come in.
Security to Counselor Troi's   quarters.
Acknowledged.
I don't understand... Lieutenant   Worf said you wanted to talk to me   about something.
Where is he?
He said he had to go somewhere.
Troi to Worf.
Computer...
Where is Lieutenant Worf?
Lieutenant Worf is in Ensign   Calloway's quarters.
Take Lieutenant Pierce to his   quarters and hold him there.
Security override, authorization   Troi Delta-two-nine.
Worf...
Stop it --
Stop it --
He's dead... you killed him...
No... no...
You know what you have to do...
I know... what I have to do...
Plasma venting system will engage   in... seventy seconds.
What were you doing?
You're alive... you're all   right...
-- I opened the maintenance door   at Counselor Troi's request, then   turned and saw that she had moved   too close to the force-field.
It all seemed so real to me. It's   hard to imagine that everything I   experienced happened in just those   few seconds...
It appears that you were correct,   Counselor. Lieutenant Pierce was   partially telepathic -- his   maternal grandmother was from   Betazed.
What else have you found?
According to Starfleet records,   Pierce and the other two persons   Counselor Troi identified were   killed in an accidental plasma   discharge eight years ago. Their   bodies were never found.
I don't believe it was an   accident. I think that Pierce   found out that the other two were   having an affair. He lost   control... and killed them both.
Afterwards, he probably activated   the plasma stream, then threw   himself into it.
The plasma discharge would have   obliterated any evidence that it   was murder.

I scanned behind the panel   Counselor Troi asked me to look   at. I didn't find any bone   fragments... but I did find traces   of cellular residue. It's showing   some kind of... empathic   signature.
It may be that when Lieutenant   Pierce was struck by the plasma   stream, the subspace energy   present there imprinted his   empathic pattern into the residue.
Kind of like a... psychic   photograph.
That's what triggered my   hallucination... My mind must   have taken elements from my own   life and created a situation that   in many ways paralleled what   happened to Pierce.
If you hadn't been there, I would   have jumped... just like he did...
Counselor...
Yes?
When I pulled you away from the   plasma stream, you seemed...   surprised that I was alive.
Well... actually, in my   hallucination... you were killed.
May I ask by whom?
You know what they say, Worf...       Hell hath no fury like a woman   scorned...
